indexed_text: Accounting Class Usages

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Accounting class usages is a classification or grouping of accounting event classes to be used in a report or process based on subledger journal entries.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: A report or process referring to such a group would only process subledger journal entries tagged with the accounting event classes defined in the group.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Manage Accounting Class Usages Task

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: The Manage Accounting Class Usages task enables you to group accounting event classes. Use Accounting Class Usages assignments to determine which subledger journal entry lines to retrieve for a particular process. For example, for mass additions a subledger can define accounting class usages to identify the journal entry lines that must be processed to create records for another subledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Defining Accounting Class Usages

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Use the Manage Accounting Class Usages task to create assignments that may be associated with a ledger. In the Accounting Class Assignments region, assign accounting classes to an assignment definition.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Predefined processes and assignment definitions cannot be deleted or updated. You can copy a predefined assignment definition and modify if necessary.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Accrual Reversals in Accounting Hub

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: To use accrual reversal, you assign application or standard date sources to the Accrual Reversal Accounting Date Source accounting attribute. When this accounting attribute has a value, the Create Accounting process generates an entry that reverses the accrual entry.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Here's what you do to define how and when accrual reversals are automatically performed:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Indicate that an accounting event is eligible for accrual reversal.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Determine when the accrual is reversed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Schedule the Create Accrual Reversal Accounting process to generate the reversal entries of the accrual.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Note: You must not enable reversal in General Ledger journal for the journal source and category if accrual reversal is implemented in subledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Accrual Reversal Process Steps

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: This flow chart shows the accrual reversal process in Accounting Hub.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Note: End Date: The date till when the Create Accounting process selects accounting events for processing.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: 1. Assign a date source to the Accrual Reversal Accounting Date Source accounting attribute at the event class level.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|The following predefined attributes cannot be updated.
indexed_text: Use this attribute to schedule the automatic reversal of a journal entry. On the Manage Accounting Attributes page, assign any standard date source or one of these application sources to the Accrual Reversal Accounting Date Source accounting attribute as a nondefault assignment:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Next Day: The accounting date of the accrual reversal is the next day following the accounting date of the accrual entry. First Day of Next Accounting Period: The accounting date of the accrual reversal entry is the first day of the following accounting period. Last Day of Next Accounting Period: The accounting date of the accrual reversal entry is the last day of the following accounting period.
indexed_text: Note: If a default source is assigned to the Accrual Reversal Accounting Date Source accounting attribute, it will be assigned to all the journal entry rule set defined for the event class.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Next Day: The accounting date of the accrual reversal is the next day following the accounting date of the accrual entry. First Day of Next Accounting Period: The accounting date of the accrual reversal entry is the first day of the following accounting period. Last Day of Next Accounting Period: The accounting date of the accrual reversal entry is the last day of the following accounting period.

indexed_text: For all valid accrual journal entries, the Create Accounting process also creates the accrual reversal journal entry. You use the Reversal Method option on the Manage Subledger Accounting Options page to specify the method to use for reversals.

indexed_text: Future trading requires a margin account that's market-to-market on a daily basis. This means that the investor or ledger's gains or losses on the position are reflected on a daily basis. If the margin account is less than a specified amount (the maintenance of the margin), a margin call is issued. This requires the holder of the account to replenish the account to the initial margin level or close out the position.

indexed_text: 1. Define a user-defined formula determining how to distribute the entered amount across accounting periods. If required, you can use the new multiperiod predefined sources. For example:

indexed_text: Assign the formula or source to the Entered Amount accounting attribute in the Manage Accounting Attributes task. 2. Assign a source to each of the following accounting attributes to indicate the multiperiod date range.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: 3. Define Multiperiod Classes using the Manage Subledger Accounting Lookups task.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Lookup Type: ORA_XLA_MULTIPERIOD_CLASS
indexed_text: 4. Define a non-multiperiod Journal Line Rule for the deferral entry specifying the Multiperiod Class. This rule is used to post the fee amount to the deferral account.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Lookup Type: ORA_XLA_MULTIPERIOD_CLASS
indexed_text: Define a non-multiperiod Journal Line Rule for the accrual entry:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Disable the Multiperiod option and specify a Multiperiod Class. Assign a source that has the accrual amount to the Entered Amount accounting attribute. Assign relevant sources to the Multiperiod Start Date and Multiperiod End Date accounting attributes.
indexed_text: 5. Define a multiperiod Journal Line Rule for the recognition entry:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Enable the Multiperiod option and assign the same Multiperiod Class as in the non-multiperiod Journal Line Rule created in step 4 above. Assign the user-defined formula to the Entered Amount accounting attribute. Assign relevant sources to the Multiperiod Start Date and Multiperiod End Date accounting attributes.
indexed_text: 6. Assign both journal line rules to the same journal entry rule set with:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|A deferral account rule assigned to the non-multiperiod journal line rule. A revenue or expense account rule assigned to the multiperiod journal line rule.
indexed_text: 7. Assign the journal entry rule set to the accounting method. 8. Schedule the Create Multiperiod Accounting process to run after the Create Accounting process so that recognition journal entries are properly booked each period. If multiperiod accounting is also implemented in any of the subledger level secondary ledgers, you must schedule the Create Multiperiod Accounting process for the primary ledger as well as each of its subledger level secondary ledgers.

indexed_text: Assign the user-defined formula to the Entered Amount accounting attribute.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date = Origination date Multiperiod End Date = Maturity date
indexed_text: The Create Multiperiod Accounting process calculates entered amount for the multiperiod entries as:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date = Origination date Multiperiod End Date = Maturity date
indexed_text: Entered Amount = Amount Returned by User-Defined formula - Multiperiod Recognized Entered Amount

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: - Multiperiod Recognized Entered Amount is calculated and stored in the Accounting Hub data model as the total amount recognized for the transaction in prior periods. The approach handles any rounding differences in prorated entered currency amounts.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: Sample User-Defined Formulas

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: These sample user-defined formula definitions can be used to prorate the loan fee amount.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: Prorate by Number of Periods

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: To prorate the entered amount evenly across each period:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: " Multiperiod Original Entered Amount" * NumberofGLPeriod ("Origination Date", "Last Day of Current Accounting Period") / NumberofGLPeriod ("Origination Date", "Maturity Date")

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: - Multiperiod Original Entered Amount, Origination Date and Maturity Date are standard application sources (Application: Loans). - Last Day of Current Accounting Period is a system source (Application: Subledger Accounting). - NumberofGLPeriod is a predefined numeric function.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: Using Multiperiod Accounting for Foreign Currency

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: In the multiperiod accounting journal for foreign currency, the accounted amount is derived from the accrued amount / entered amount on the accrual line.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: To calculate the accounted amount for multiperiod recognition entries, follow this logic:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: 1. Calculate the unrounded entered amount to be recognized from the multiperiod start date to the last day of the current period. 2. Calculate the unrounded entered amount to be recognized for the current period as Step 1 minus the total rounded entered amount from all multiperiod recognition lines in previous periods. 3. Calculate the unrounded accounted amount for the current period as Step 2* accrual accounted amount/ accrual entered amount. 4. The last multiperiod recognition entry will include a rounding difference, so it's calculated as: 'accrual amount' minus 'total amount from all multiperiod recognition lines in previous periods', for both entered and accounted amounts.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: Here's an example illustrating the exact amount on a customer's invoice.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: (("Multiperiod Original Entered Amount" * NumberOfGLPeriod("Invoice Distribution Multiperiod Accounting Start Date","Last Day of Current Accounting Period")) / NumberOfGLPeriod("Invoice Distribution Multiperiod Accounting Start Date","Invoice Distribution Multiperiod Accounting End Date"))

indexed_text: Prerequisites

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: Provide date format sources to store the multiperiod start and end dates in transaction objects.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Where the:
indexed_text: For the event class that supports multiperiod accounting, assign these sources to the accounting attributes:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Define the multiperiod class in the subledger accounting lookup. The multiperiod class is used to identify the journal line for which the amount is prorated across multiple accounting periods.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Tip: Accounted amounts for multiperiod journals are calculated by the Create Multiperiod Accounting process prorating proportionally to the entered amount. Rounding error differences are included in the prorated amount. Multiperiod transaction data must be available in transaction objects until the last multiperiod entry has been accounted in final status.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Related Topics

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Multiperiod Accounting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Considerations for Multiperiod Accounting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Manage User-Defined Formulas

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Considerations for Multiperiod Accounting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To achieve a successful implementation of multiperiod accounting feature in Accounting Hub, the following points must be taken into consideration.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Determine when to raise a new accounting event

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Determine when a new accounting event must be raised throughout the life cycle of a multiperiod transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If only the multiperiod start and end dates are changed, a new accounting event isn't required. As the transaction object is maintained to provide the new multiperiod start date, the impact of the change is reflected in the next multiperiod journal.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Raise a new accounting event if the amount is changed, or a transaction is canceled after the transaction is accounted in a Final status.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If the multiperiod start date is changed after the transaction is accounted, it's not necessary to raise a new accounting event. The assumption is that all other transaction attributes remain the same. If the transaction object is maintained to provide the new multiperiod start date, the impact of the change is reflected in the next multiperiod journal. This depends on the prorate method and is also true for future journal entries.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: However, if the transaction amount is changed after the transaction is accounted; the new accounting event is needed, which affects the total deferral amount.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Tip: We suggest a detailed analysis be performed to determine whether to raise a new accounting event when transaction attributes are updated.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Raise a transaction reversal event

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Consider the multiperiod journal accounting date when raising the transaction reversal event.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Set the reversal accounting date to a date after the last multiperiod journal with Final status. A reversal entry reverses all existing final entries, including the multiperiod journals, with the reversal accounting date.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: For example, the transaction accounting date is on 01-Feb and multiperiod journals have been created for February and March with a Final status. If the transaction is canceled, the cancellation event should be set to 01-Apr or the first day of the next open period, whichever is later.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Provide the multiperiod start and end dates

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The multiperiod start date and multiperiod end date must be provided in transaction objects for event classes that support multiperiod accounting. These date sources are mapped to the accounting attributes Multiperiod Start Date and Multiperiod End Date for the event class. They must both be blank or both be populated in the transaction objects.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Once a multiperiod journal is created in Final status, the multiperiod end date should not be modified to any day prior to the accounting date of the last multiperiod journal in the primary and secondary ledgers.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Deferring the multiperiod end date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: When you're deferring the multiperiod end date, then the recognition amount has to be adjusted. As the recognition line isn't generated based on the journal line rule, the switch debit and credit option isn't applicable. The appropriate offsetting entry for the positive or negative amount is generated to offset the extra recognition.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: For example, if you're extending for 3 months and have already run the multiperiod accounting for the first 2 months, you would have recognized more than the amount required to offset; hence a negative entry will be generated.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Provide the multiperiod transaction data

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Multiperiod transaction data must be available in subledger transaction objects until the last multiperiod entry is accounted in Final status.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: At least one line level transaction object is required for the event class to use multiperiod feature. Ensure transaction objects are populated with current data for the multiperiod transaction throughout the life cycle of multiperiod, even if the transaction is accounted.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: For example, if the multiperiod start date is changed after the transaction is accounted but not all future entries have been accounted. The new multiperiod start date should be populated in the transaction object. This enables the Create Multiperiod Accounting process to calculate the prorate amount according to the modified multiperiod date range.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Process the multiperiod accounting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Multiperiod recognition entries are created based on transaction objects data and accounting rule definition at the time the Create Multiperiod Accounting process is executed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The entered amount value for the multiperiod journal is calculated by a formula. This formula is assigned to the Entered Amount accounting attribute on the multiperiod journal line rule.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The accounted amount value for multiperiod journals is calculated by the Create Multiperiod Accounting process, prorating proportionally to the entered amount, including rounding differences.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Multiperiod accounting entries aren't created:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If any subledger level reporting currency or secondary ledger is disabled, although the multiperiod transaction may not be fully recognized yet.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If subledger level reporting currency is added after the journal is created in Final status, the multiperiod journal isn't created for the new reporting currency.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If the transaction accounting date is prior to the first open period of a reporting currency or secondary ledger, the journal isn't created for the reporting currency or secondary ledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Multiperiod transactions are processed by the Create Multiperiod Accounting process only once for each accounting period and transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Don't modify the multiperiod start date for a transaction to a date in a prior accounting period of the last multiperiod journal in primary and secondary ledgers.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: If the multiperiod start date for a transaction is modified to a date in a prior accounting period, accounting periods that were previously processed for the transaction by the Create Multiperiod Accounting process aren't processed, regardless of the period status. Any adjustment in the prorated amount due to change of start date will be accounted in the next accounting period.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Overview of Sequencing of Accounting Entries

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The following sequences are attached to subledger journal entries or general ledger journal entries. These two sequences aren't mutually exclusive and can coexist in the same journal entry.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Accounting Sequence

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The accounting sequence is assigned to subledger journal entries at the time that the journal entry is completed. The sequence is assigned in the completion date order using the accounting date as the date criterion for determining the sequence to be used.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Reporting Sequence

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The reporting sequence is assigned to both subledger journal entries and general ledger journal entries when the accounting period is closed. This sequence is used by most of the legal reports required in some countries as the main sorting criterion to display the journal entries.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Note: In some related documents, this sequence is referred to as the chronological sequence.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Transaction Reversal

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: You can import a new transaction record to Accounting Hub to reverse the accounting of a transaction in the same batch or an existing transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Make sure that the new transaction record includes these values:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The same transaction number as the transaction you want to reverse.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The value of the reversal indicator as Y.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Here's what happens when you import the new transaction record. Accounting Hub generates a reversal accounting that offsets the accounting of the original transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Note:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Line record is not needed when importing reversal records.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The GL date for the reversal should be prior to or the same as the GL date of the non-reversal journal entry.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Example of Transaction Reversal

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Let's say that an accounting transaction with transaction number 1001 is imported and accounted in Accounting Hub successfully. Later, this transaction is canceled in the source system.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To reverse the accounting transaction created in Accounting Hub, you import a new accounting transaction with the same transaction number 1001 and set the reversal indicator as Y. After the new accounting transaction record is imported, Accounting Hub creates journal entries to offset the accounting effect from the original transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Before You Start

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Here are some of the things you must do before you can start using transaction reversals:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Enable the Flexible Configuration of the Accounting Flow feature.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Opt in to enable this feature.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Enable transaction reversal for subledgers that use this feature.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Download and use the latest transaction template for the subledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Other Implementation Considerations

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: You might be wondering how to reverse a multiperiod accounting transaction. In such a case, make sure that the transaction date for the reversal record is on or after the accounting date of the last multiperiod accounting entry of the transaction being reversed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Import Accounting Hub Reversal Transactions with User-Specified Reversal Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: You can configure an accounting rule to use a user-specified source as the reversal accounting date for Accounting Hub transactions. This provides you with the flexibility to use other date sources as the accounting date for both original and reversal transactions.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: You can configure the accounting date of subledger journal entries to not depend on the transaction date and use the accounting date for reversal transactions too.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: This feature lets you account for backdated transactions. Make sure you account for backdated transactions in the current period by keeping the original transaction date for reference. If you choose to do this, you'll need to select a date source other than the predefined Transaction Date source for the Accounting Date accounting attribute.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Note: There's no need to import reversal in any specific order. If the reversal record is imported before the non- reversal record, the reversal will be held in the interface table. When the non-reversal record is imported, the Import Accounting Transaction process checks the interface table and processes the reversal record with the same transaction number.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting Reporting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Oracle Fusion Subledger Accounting Predefined Reports

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Oracle Subledger Accounting provides accounting reports for fiscal and internal control purposes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The reports are comprehensive from a financial standpoint and include the best source of information for each type of journal entry. These reports can be used in lieu of the General Ledger-based journals and account analysis reports to see detailed subledger journal entries as well as supporting transaction information.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Scheduled Processes work area

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Reports can be scheduled and run from the Scheduled Processes work area found in Tools on the Navigator.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Reports and Analytics work area

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: In some cases, reports are also:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: These reports are available from the Reports and Analytics work area, found in Tools on the Navigator, or from other work areas.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Opened using links that deploy the business intelligence (BI) catalog.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The following table contains the primary predefined reports by type:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Account Analysis Reports

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: This table contains a listing of Subledger Accounting account analysis reports.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Display Name Description

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Account Analysis Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Provides drill down information about the movement on a particular account for a period or range of periods. It only includes journal entries posted to general ledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Account Analysis by Legal Entity Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Prints account balances by account combination and selected segments with subledger journal details, including third-party information and sequences. Flexible grouping and sorting options are provided at submission.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Journal Reports

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: This table contains a listing of Subledger Accounting journal reports.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Display Name Description

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Daily Journals Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Lists subledger journal activity for a given period or date range, journal source, entered currency, and journal batch. Report prints detailed subledger journal lines prior to general ledger summarization. Third party and transaction details are also listed for the journal lines.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Journal Entries Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Displays detailed information for subledger and general ledger journal entries. Groups report by ledger, journal source, journal category, and event class at submission.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Journal Ledger Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Lists the accounting entries with subledger details like transaction number, transaction date, and line description, using flexible sorting options that are provided at report submission. This report provides a real audit trail between general ledger and subledgers to satisfy legal and business requirements.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Journals and Third Party Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Prints all journals posted in Oracle Fusion General Ledger for the accounting period. The report provides accounting and reporting sequence details, detailed subledger accounting entry lines reporting level regardless of the ledger journals summarization. Assists in verifying that all journals are accurately recorded in chronological order with no gaps. It uses legal sequencing rules for both accounting entries and source documents.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Detail Journal Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Displays information about the posted general ledger journal batches that originate from Oracle Fusion Receivables and Oracle Fusion Payables subledgers. The report prints subledger details like transaction number, transaction date, transaction amount in entered and ledger currency.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Other Subledger Accounting Reports

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: This table contains a listing of other Subledger Accounting reports.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Display Name Description

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Accounting Event Diagnostic Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Shows the transaction data used in accounting. The data is collected when the profile option SLA: Enable Diagnostics is set and the Create Accounting process is run.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting Method Setups Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Displays the accounting setups for a subledger application and accounting method.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Period Close Exceptions Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Lists all accounting events and journal entries that fail period close validation. Groups report by ledger, period, journal source, journal category, and event class at submission.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To run predefined reports, navigate to the Scheduled Processes work area and follow these steps:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: 1. Click the Schedule New Process button 2. Search on the process name. 3. Enter your parameters. 4. Enter your process options and schedule. 5. Click Submit.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting Subject Areas, Folders, and Attributes

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To create real-time analyses for Oracle Fusion Subledger Accounting you should be familiar with subject areas, folders, and attributes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subject Areas

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To create an analysis, you begin by selecting a subject area from which you select columns of information to include in the analysis. For example, to create an analysis of journal information, you begin by selecting a Subledger Accounting- Journals Real Time subject area. Subject areas are based around a business object or fact. In this example, the subject area is based on the column in the subledger entries tables.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting has 2 specific subject areas:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting- Journals Real Time

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subledger Accounting - Supporting References Real Time

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Folders

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Each subject area has one fact folder and a number of dimension folders. Fact folders contain attributes that can be measured, meaning that they're numeric values like journal debit and credit amounts. Fact folders are in the list of folders and are usually named after the subject area. Dimension folders contain attribute and hierarchical columns like journal name and accounting period.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Some folders appear in more than one subject area, such as Time. These are referred to as common folders or common dimensions.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Each folder within a subject area may have a different level of granularity. For example:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Accounting Class has accounting class attributes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Bill-to Customer has subfolders and attributes within the subfolders.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Attributes

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Finally, each dimension folder contains attributes (columns), such as balance type and posting date. This figure illustrates the structure of subject areas, folders, and attributes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: This figure illustrates the subject area listing that includes the Subledger Accounting - Journals Real Time subject area, folders, and attributes.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: The figure illustrates these components:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Subject area: Subledger Accounting - Journals Real Time

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Dimension - Presentation Folder: Accounting Class

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Dimension - Attributes: Accounting Class Code, Accounting Class Description and Accounting Class Meaning.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Fact - Presentation Folder: Journals

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Fact - Measures: Journal Line Accounted Amount CR, Journal Line Accounted Amount DR, Journal Line Entered Amount CR, Journal Line Entered Amount DR, Journal Line Statistical Amount, Unrounded Accounted Amount CR, Unrounded Accounted Amount DR, Unrounded Entered Amount CR, and Unrounded Entered Amount DR.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Related Topics

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: How Data Is Structured for Analytics

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Access the Create Multiperiod Accounting Execution Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: When you submit the Create Multiperiod Accounting process, the Create Multiperiod Accounting Execution Report is automatically submitted. In this report, you can see entries created by the Create Multiperiod Accounting process.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Here is what you do to recreate a Create Multiperiod Accounting Execution Report.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Submit the Create Multiperiod Accounting process.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Use the same request identifier of the required Create Multiperiod Accounting process that was run previously by the same user. Also, no other Create Multiperiod Accounting process should have been run with the same criteria.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: To get the best performance, we recommend using the predefined version of the data model and report.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Here are the steps you need to take to remove any customizations already made to the Create Multiperiod Accounting Execution Report::

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: 1. Log in to BI Publisher Enterprise through the BI Publisher URL. 2. Locate /Shared Folders/Custom/Financials/Fusion Accounting Hub in the Folders pane. 3. Delete Create Multiperiod Accounting Execution Report from this folder. 4. Delete Create Multiperiod Accounting Data Model under/Shared Folders/Custom/Financials/Fusion Accounting Hub/Data Models folder.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Before you create a supporting reference report, you must ensure that supporting references are assigned to journal lines in the journal entry rule set and then the accounting created .

indexed_text: 1. From the Home page, click Navigator > Reports and Analytics . 2. Open the Create drop down. 3. Select Analysis . 4. Select Subject Area: Subledger Accounting - Supporting Reference Real Time .

indexed_text: View the supporting reference report from the navigation pane.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: 1. Expand the navigation pane. 2. Expand My Folders . 3. Click your report name. 4. Click View action. 5. The supporting reference balances report is displayed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Note: If you don't see any data, the balances may not yet be updated. In that case, you must run the Update Subledger Accounting Balances process and then view again.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Related Topics

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Supporting References

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: FAQs for Subledger Accounting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Can I have multiple event classes for applications created in spreadsheets?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: No, use multiple event types instead. The setup upload creates a separate event type for each transaction type defined in the Source System worksheet. You can also add new event types in the event model from the Manage Subledger Application page.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Can I have subledger accounting entries in Adjustment Only ledgers?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: No, you can use Adjustment Only ledgers for General Ledger manual journals only. However, you can define a Subledger level secondary ledger with valuation method enabled and use it for subledger journal adjustments.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: You can then create a ledger set to combine the secondary ledger with the primary ledger. Use the ledger set while running reports to obtain a complete accounting representation that includes both transactional data and adjustments.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Can I import transactions into adjusting periods directly?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: No, you can import accounting transactions only to nonadjusting periods. However, you can create subledger journal adjustments in adjusting periods from the Create Subledger Journal Entry page. You can also upload subledger journal adjustments in adjusting periods using the Create Subledger Journals spreadsheet.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Can I enable flexible configuration only for select subledger applications?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: No. If you enable the Flexible Configuration of Accounting Hub Cloud Service End to End Flow feature, it applies to all subledger applications.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Can I adjust accounting date when processing backdated transactions?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Backdated transactions would be accounted with errors if the corresponding accounting period is closed. You can delete invalid transactions, adjust dates in the data file, and import again.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Related Topics

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Overview of Accounting Hub Maintenance

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: Run the Accounting Hub Maintenance Process to Delete Transactions

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: How do the Subledger Journal Entry Descriptions Get Translated?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: In the journal entry description, the Journal Language determines which language is used to retrieve and store the subledger journal sources.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date
indexed_text: In all predefined subledgers, multiple languages are supported, and as soon as the Create Accounting process is completed, the sources used in the description are retrieved and saved in the appropriate language. The translated source values used in the journal description will be retrieved using the session language of the user who submitted the Create Accounting process.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|7 Subledger Accounting|Multiperiod Start Date Multiperiod End Date

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Overview of Intercompany Processing Rules

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Define intercompany system options to set up intercompany processing rules at the enterprise level, based on your specific business needs.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: To maintain consistency throughout an enterprise, intercompany transaction processing rules should be defined at the enterprise level. By standardizing these rules, an enterprise can minimize disputes, decrease processing time, and cut administrative costs.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Before setting up intercompany system options, you must determine how to process your intercompany transactions. For example, to:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Enforce an enterprise-wide currency or allow intercompany transactions in local currencies.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Allow receivers to reject intercompany transactions.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Determine the minimum transaction amount that's processed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Overview of Intercompany Balancing Rules

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Intercompany balancing rules are used to generate the accounts needed to balance journals that are out of balance by legal entity or primary balancing segment values.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: You specify the intercompany receivables and intercompany payables accounts that you want to use as the template for building the intercompany receivables and intercompany payables accounts. The intercompany balancing feature then uses these rules to generate the accounts of the balancing lines it creates.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Journals lines are first summarized by the legal entity and are balanced by the legal entity. Since a legal entity can have many primary balancing segment values, it's possible that a journal could have multiple lines for a legal entity with different primary balancing segment values. In that case, when intercompany balancing is done, the lowest primary balancing segment value within each legal entity in the journal is used. After this, balancing occurs across balancing segment values within each legal entity.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: These same rules are also used to generate the intercompany receivables account and intercompany payables account of transactions entered in the Intercompany module.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The intercompany balancing rules are also used to generate the intercompany receivables account for the provider side of an intercompany transaction. The balancing rules also used to generate the intercompany payables account for the receiver side of an intercompany transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Overview of Intercompany Allocations

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The two processes you can use for intercompany allocation generation are Generate Intercompany Allocations and Generate General Ledger Allocations. You can use both processes for single-ledger allocations or cross-ledger allocations.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The Generate Intercompany Allocations process updates Oracle Fusion Intercompany tables. The Generate General Ledger Allocations process updates Oracle Fusion General Ledger tables.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: How can I use social networking to discuss intercompany allocation adjustments with cost center owners?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Use the social feature on the Intercompany Transactions work area to invite others to share information.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Here's how you use the social feature:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: 1. Navigate to the Intercompany Transactions work area. 2. Search for the intercompany transaction. 3. Click Social and then click Share. Optionally, click Join to join an existing conversation. 4. Create a related conversation. And invite other cost center owners to join the conversation. 5. Upload the allocation spreadsheet for them to review. As cost center owners, you can post questions. And other cost center owners can see responses to the questions because they're owners.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Each cost center owner can validate their intercompany allocation in the conversation itself. This creates a lasting record.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Intercompany Reconciliation

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Generate the Intercompany Reconciliation Report

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Use the Reconciliation Report to reconcile your inner company accounts.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Perform the following steps to generate the Intercompany Reconciliation Report:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: 1. Navigate to the Springboard items from the landing page. 2. Click General Accounting Infolets. 3. On the IC Reconciliation infolet, click Reconcile Intercompany Accounts to start the Extract Intercompany Reconciliation process. 4. Click Actions and then click Run. 5. Select the value for the report parameters: Provider Ledger, Provider Accounting Period, and Additional Currency .

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Note: Ensure that the entries in the fields Provider Ledger and Provider Accounting Period match the ledger on the dashboard. The Additional Currency must also match the currency of the ledger on the dashboard.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: 6. Select Conversion Rate Type and Conversion Date . These two parameters are enabled after you select the Additional Currency . 7. Click Submit . 8. Click Refresh until you see the report.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Note: The Period summary report is displayed only after the Extract Intercompany Reconciliation process is completed.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: 9. Click Actions drop-down list and select History to view previously run reports in the Period Summary. If the Provider Legal Entity or Receiver Legal Entity is displayed as 'unassigned', it means the primary balancing segment value on the balancing line isn't assigned to a legal entity. 10. Select an item under Entered Amount Difference in Transaction Currency column to view the Summary by Source report. 11. Review Intercompany Receivables GL Balance and Intercompany Payables GL Balance in the Summary by Source report. Identify the roles which have a higher balance and the journal lines that are in one, but may not be in the other balance.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Note: If there is a difference between the Intercompany receivables and payables amounts, drill down further on both intercompany receivables and payables amounts to identify the journal lines that appear in one but not the other.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: a. Click the line which appears in one but not the other. b. On the Journal Lines page, click the journal name to review it and determine if it has been correctly posted to the intercompany account. c. If the journal has been posted incorrectly, reverse it so that the Intercompany Receivables GL Balance and Intercompany Payables GL Balance accounts on Summary by Source report match.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Overview of Intercompany Reconciliation

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Intercompany reconciliation provides you with reports to assist you with reconciling your intercompany receivables and intercompany payables accounts and identifying differences.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The main goal of the reports is to make it easy for you to identify either the receiver side or provider side of a transaction that has not been posted to the intercompany receivables or intercompany payables account.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The reports show the following intercompany lines:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Intercompany receivables and intercompany payables lines generated by the intercompany balancing feature.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Intercompany receivables and intercompany payables lines generated for the provider and receiver of each intercompany transaction.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: The following are not included on the intercompany reconciliation reports:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|8 Intercompany Processing Rules
indexed_text: Ledger balancing lines generated when the primary balancing segment value is in balance but either the second balancing segment or the third balancing segment is out of balance

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations
indexed_text: Select the best consolidation solution for your enterprise:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations
indexed_text: Reporting Only Consolidations : If your subsidiaries and corporate ledger share the same chart of accounts and calendar.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations
indexed_text: Balance Transfer Consolidations : If your subsidiaries and corporate ledger have either or both different charts of accounts and different calendars.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations
indexed_text: Financial Management Consolidations : If there are complex factors in your financial consolidation requirements such as:

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|9 Consolidations|Complex company structures such as joint ventures, minority interest holdings, partially or fully owned subsidiaries. As long as you have read or write access to the target ledger you can drill down to the source ledger. However, you are limited to just that drill path and cannot see other journals for the target ledger.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: Overview of Budget Configuration

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: In Oracle General Ledger, you can load budget data to perform variance reporting.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: If you use a third-party budgeting application or don't use a budgeting application, there are two ways to load budgets into the GL Balances Cube.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: Importing Budget Data from a Flat File : Export budget data from your budgeting application to a comma separated values .csv file. Use the Import General Ledger Budget Balances file-based data import to prepare and generate flat files in a .csv format. You can use Oracle Application Development Framework Desktop Integrator correction worksheets to correct validation errors, delete rows with errors, and resubmit the corrected error rows.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: Note: For more information about file-based data import, see the File-Based Data Import for Oracle Financials Cloud guide.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: Importing Budget Data from a Spreadsheet : You can access the budget load spreadsheet from the General Accounting Dashboard. Enter, load, and correct budget data in the ADF Desktop Integrator spreadsheet tool. Use this tool to prepare and load budget data for multiple ledgers and periods with a common chart of accounts instance. The list of values and the web picker help you select valid values. This simplified data entry reduces errors and alerts you to errors as you enter the data in the spreadsheet. Error correction is done in the same spreadsheet.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: The following figure shows the process flow for budget upload. Prepare your budget data, upload it using a spreadsheet or flat file, and report on the budget data.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|10 Budget Configuration
indexed_text: CAUTION: When the GL Balances Cube is rebuilt, the process retains the budget balances as well as the actual balances. Only the budget balances loaded using the spreadsheet or flat file through the GL Budget Balances interface table are retained. Create reports in Smart View or Financial Reporting to verify that the budget data was loaded correctly.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: Overview of Financial Reporting

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: The Financial Reporting Center is a powerful tool for reviewing, designing, and presenting financial reports and analytic data. It adds self-service functionality for the Oracle Fusion Applications and Oracle Accounting Hub.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: The financial reports are available immediately on both computers and mobile devices, which leads to quicker decision making.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: The Financial Reporting Center is intended to be the primary user interface for financials end users to access all seven report types.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: How can I apply permissions to objects from Financial Reporting in Workspace?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: Open the Permission dialog box from the Tasks list to set permissions for a catalog object.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: Permissions determine which user, group, or role can view, open, or modify the object. If you display this dialog box while working in the catalog in Workspace, any permission changes that you specify are applied immediately. If you display this dialog box as part of the Batch Scheduler wizard, then the permission changes aren't applied until you run the batch.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: How can I migrate Financial Reports from one environment to another?

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: You can export your financial reports from a source environment and import them to a target environment using implementation projects.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: Only the financial reports in the /shared/Custom/Financials folder are exported, so make sure to copy all the financial reports, or the folders containing them, to this folder. In the Setup and Maintenance work area, create an implementation project that includes only the Create Financial Statements task. Then use the Manage Configuration Packages task to export and import the reports.

section_id: Oracle Fusion Cloud Financials|11 Financial Reporting
indexed_text: Note: For the Financial Reporting report definition migration service, from a source to a target environment, references to version IDs of dimension members hierarchies are synced to their version IDs in the target environment.
